intro: Trigonotis coreana, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open woodland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Trigonotis coreana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
